Judul: FORMULATION AND EVALUATION OF EUCHEUMA COTTONII SEAWEED TABLET DOSAGE FORM
Abstrak:
Background: The rise of prevalence of obesity worldwide simultaneously boosts the market
of weight loss supplements. Due to reports of synthetic drugs side effects, the consumers are
opting for safer alternatives such as herbal derived products. Eucheuma cottonii seaweed was
recognised as a potential solution for weight management due to its high fiber content and
other health benefits. Objective: The aim of this research was to develop a proper diminution
method for Eucheuma cottonii seaweed into powder and preparation of its tablet. Method(s):
The Eucheuma cottonii seaweed was powderised by dry method and wet method. The work
flow for wet method started with blending the seaweed in an electronic blender to obtain a
homogenous dispersion of seaweed prior the soaking for 24 hours. The „liquidized?seaweed
was dried in the oven at 60?for 48 hours. The dried seaweed was weighed and grinded
using ball mill or rotary cutter mill for 1 hour. Meanwhile for the dry method, the seaweed
was dried in the oven at 60?for 24 hours and the grinding step was repeated similarly. The
grinded seaweed sample was sieved using a series of sieve size ranging from 1180 µm, 850
µm, 500 µm, 355 µm and 300 µm. Powder retained at the sieve was evaluated for
compatibility, flowability and swelling capacity. The powder with the best compactibility
property was selected for tablet preparation. Approximately 300 mg of the chosen powder
and 450 mg of filler excipients such as lactose monohydrate, bolus alba, calcium sulphate,
calcium carbonate or Avicel PH 101 were mixed and compressed into a tablet and its
disintegration time was then evaluated. The final tablet was prepared using various
concentration seaweed powders (300 mg, 400 mg or 500 mg) at final tablet weight of 750
mg. Result(s): Production of powder from wet method and dry method yielded 114.67 g and
92.92 g respectively. Meanwhile the hardness of tablet at 5 ton during the compatibility test
for powder from sieve size 1180 µm, 850 µm and 500 µm was not able to be recorded. The
hardness of tables from sieve size 355 µm and 300 µm powder was 1.08 kg and 2.5 kg
respectively. The disintegration time of seaweed tablet with filler lactose monohydrate, bolus
alba, calcium sulphate, calcium carbonate or Avicel PH 101 was 9?35”, 11?68”, 10?22”,
10?70”and 20?26”respectively. From the tablet evaluation, tablet containing 300 mg and 400
mg seaweed sample with lactose as filler confirms as requirement. Conclusion: The
diminution method that was most efficient in yielding the powder was the wet method
seaweed preparation using rotary cutter mill. The tablet containing the seaweed powder of
300 mg and 400 mg fulfilled the tablet specification tested.
